title: Mesut Mert
text:
Mesut Mert (born 18 March 1978) is a Bulgarian-born Canadian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and former player who serves as an assistant coach for <a href="HFX%20Wanderers%20FC">HFX Wanderers</a> and as head coach of the <a href="Saint%20Mary%27s%20Huskies">Saint Mary's University</a> men's soccer team.
Playing career.
Mert made his USL debut with the <a href="Calgary%20Mustangs%20%28USL%29">Calgary Mustangs</a> but joined Montreal for the 2005 season after Calgary folded.
Coaching career.
Mert was named Technical Director of Scotia SC on 22 September 2007. As of 2011, he continues as coach and player of Suburban FC's Senior A Premier Men's Division, in the <a href="Nova%20Scotia%20Soccer%20League">Nova Scotia Soccer League</a>.
On 3 March 2020, Mert joined <a href="Canadian%20Premier%20League">Canadian Premier League</a> side <a href="HFX%20Wanderers%20FC">HFX Wanderers</a> as an assistant coach under <a href="Stephen%20Hart%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Hart</a>.
Personal life.
Mert was born in <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a> and is of Turkish ancestry. He was brought up in <a href="City%20of%20Halifax">Halifax</a>.
